prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with the following specifications: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.2261 units - Height: 0.75 units Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the specified Euler angles and translation vector, as provided in the `coordinate_system` object: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2261, 0.0] Now, create the 2D sketch for this prism. The sketch is drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system, and it contains a single face with one loop. For the 2D sketch face: 1. Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Create a line with Start Point [0.0, 0.0] and End Point [0.75, 0.0]. - Line 2: Create a line with Start Point [0.75, 0.0] and End Point [0.75, 0.3609]. - Line 3: Create a line with Start Point [0.75, 0.3609] and End Point [0.0, 0.3609]. - Line 4: Create a line with Start Point [0.0, 0.3609] and End Point [0.0, 0.0]. The loop is closed by automatically joining the last end point to the first start point. Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the `coordinate_system` object. Next, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.2261 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 Finally, complete the construction of the first intermediate part (part_1) by performing the required boolean operation, as indicated by the `operation` value "NewBodyFeatureOperation". Describe it as `creating a new solid body`.</description>
